result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Steve J Hibbler was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Steve J Hibbler was found guilty of Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Per conversation with attorney Cubbie and instructions from ADA Vorpahl, matter set for Review on 12-02-2015 at 09:30am. sdg
Sentencing entry of 9-18-2015 is the CORRECT sentencing entry.

Defendant Steve J Hibbler in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Defendant Steve J Hibbler in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case before court for sentencing clarification.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with 14CT2363.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 3: 
Defendant sentenced to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent with 14CT2363 and Count 1.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 65 days in the House of Correction, forthwith.  Release for school. 
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 165 DAYS in the House of Correction.  To be used at agent's discretion.
* Participate in the Veteran Treatment Initiative program.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 18 months.
* Court ordered Ignition Interlock for a period of 24months. 
*Defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
*Pay restitution in the amount of $64.00 to Tammy S. and $24.30 to Oak Creek Police Departement during term of probation or civil judgement.
*As to Count 3, pay all costs fees and surcharges during term of probation or civil judgment.

As to Count 1, Defendant ordered to pay a fine in the amount of $1750.00 plus costs, penalties and surcharges during probation or a civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit if applicable to be applied.

Filed:  Order for Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
per Judge, case scheduled for further proceedings on 9-17-2015 at 9:30 am.  Parties notified.

Defendant Steve J Hibbler in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

VTI COURT - DSA
AS TO COUNTS 1 and 3:
Parties are prepared to enter into a Deferred Sentencing Agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty and entered Judgment of Conviction as charged in the criminal complaint. 

AS TO COUNTS 2 and 4:
As operation of law, court ordered counts 2 and 4 dismissed but read-in for purposes of sentencing.


Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with 14CT2363, with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 3: 
Defendant sentenced to serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with 14CT2363 and Count 1, with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 65 days in the House of Correction, forthwith.  Release for school. 
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 165 DAYS in the House of Correction.  To be used at agent's discretion.
* Participate in the Veteran Treatment Initiative program.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 36 months.
* Court ordered Ignition Interlock for a period of 36 months. 
*Defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
*Pay restitution in the amount of $64.00 to Tammy S. and $24.30 to Oak Creek Police Departement during term of probation or civil judgement.

Defendant ordered to pay a fine in the amount of $2100.00 plus costs, penalties and surcharges during probation or a civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit if applicable to be applied.

Filed:  Order for Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
